decks.notes: The main concept of this Jund Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Deathrite Shaman, while also disrupting their hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. The deck aims to control the board with versatile removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Lightning Bolt, and generate value over time through cards like Dark Confidant and Punishing Fire. Liliana of the Veil helps to further disrupt the opponent's resources, while cards like Bloodbraid Elf provide additional threats and card advantage.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and mana accelerants like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, while also utilizing cards like Dark Petition to search for combo pieces. Cabal Therapy and Duress are included to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect the combo. The goal is to cast Ad Nauseam or Past in Flames to draw through the deck for a high storm count, ultimately finishing the game with Tendrils of Agony for lethal damage. The deck requires careful sequencing and efficient use of resources to storm off successfully.

This deck focuses on deploying aggressive threats like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Abrupt Decay, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will. The deck aims to maintain tempo advantage by utilizing efficient counterspells and removal spells, while leveraging powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil for additional disruption. The mana base is streamlined to support the deck's two-color requirements, with additional utility lands like Wasteland to disrupt enemy mana bases. The deck's strategy revolves around quickly applying pressure and disrupting the opponent's plans.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage with cards like Terminus, Swords to Plowshares, Force of Will, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck utilizes Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to manipulate the top of the library and disrupt opponents' plays. It can also win through Entreat the Angels or Vendilion Clique beatdowns. The deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent until it can secure a win condition or lock the opponent out of the game.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. The core strategy revolves around utilizing cards like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares to control the board, while setting up a lock with Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to counter spells. Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage provide card advantage and flexibility in dealing with threats. The deck also has win conditions in the form of Entreat the Angels for a big swing or Council's Judgment for removal.

Utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to control the battlefield and apply pressure on the opponent quickly. By combining efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Liliana of the Veil, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while also maintaining a strong board presence. With a focus on tempo plays and resource denial through cards like Daze and Wasteland, this deck looks to outmaneuver the opponent and secure a victory through efficient plays and calculated aggression.

Utilize graveyard manipulation and fast mana to quickly cheat powerful creatures into play, disrupting opponent's plans with counter magic and hand disruption. The goal is to rapidly reanimate game-ending threats like Griselbrand, Elesh Norn, or Iona, overwhelming the opponent before they can respond. The deck focuses on efficiency and speed, aiming to win the game before the opponent can establish a stable board position. It requires careful resource management and thoughtful decision-making to navigate through opposing interaction and ensure the successful resolution of key spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Counterbalance, while efficiently dealing with threats using removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus. Card advantage is gained through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage, along with card selection from Ponder and Brainstorm. The deck also utilizes Sensei's Divining Top for additional card selection and to manipulate the top of the library.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play quickly. The deck aims to control the board with countermagic like Force of Will and Spell Pierce while digging for combo pieces with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain. The deck utilizes cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to accelerate into its powerful combos, overwhelming the opponent with giant creatures and card advantage. This deck focuses on quickly winning the game through efficient and explosive plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent, along with disruptive cards like Hymn to Tourach and Liliana of the Veil, to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck also includes powerful card draw and selection spells like Ancestral Vision and Brainstorm, along with versatile removal options like Abrupt Decay and Toxic Deluge. The mana base is built to support a consistent and flexible game plan, allowing the deck to adapt to various matchups and strategically outmaneuver the opponent.

The key concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Elves deck is to generate mana quickly and efficiently using creatures like Nettle Sentinel, Heritage Druid, and Birchlore Rangers, while also utilizing cards like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to draw through the deck and find key combo pieces such as Craterhoof Behemoth or Natural Order. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence and strong finishers, such as Ruric Thar, the Unbowed, to close out the game quickly.

This deck relies on quickly assembling the combo of Show and Tell to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Omniscience. It uses cantrips, counterspells, and tutors to ensure it can efficiently find and protect its combo pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and game-winning effects before they can set up their own game plan. The deck aims to be fast, efficient, and resilient in order to disrupt the opponent's strategy while executing its own combo.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through the use of lands. By utilizing cards like Dark Depths, Wasteland, and Maze of Ith, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gaining advantage from its own lands. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Life from the Loam and Crop Rotation to ensure consistency and maximize the value of the lands in play. The inclusion of Punishing Fire provides necessary removal and reach, while cards like Gamble and Mox Diamond help to accelerate the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of lands, utilizing cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful threats. It also aims to disrupt the opponent's land base with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, while maintaining card advantage with Life from the Loam and Exploration. The deck's win conditions come from either overwhelming the opponent with land-based threats or slowly grinding them down with Punishing Fire. It relies on efficient resource management and careful sequencing of plays to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory.

The primary focus of this Cloudpost Ramp deck is to quickly ramp up mana through lands like Cloudpost and Glimmerpost, using cards like Primeval Titan and Crop Rotation to efficiently search for key lands. The deck also utilizes strong finishers like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to quickly close out games. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Pithing Needle provide control and disruption against opponent's strategies. The deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

This deck aims to control the game by manipulating the top of the library with cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor for card advantage and control. The deck runs a suite of efficient removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to stall the opponent's game plan while setting up powerful win conditions like Entreat the Angels and Terminus. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells across different colors.
